SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
COMMERCE MARKETPLACE
Price Books

In the Commerce Marketplace you have access to Default, Sale, and Customer Group price books. Each price book provides pricing information for products that the Marketplace operator and seller make available in the storefront. Also, in a price book you can find price book entries that contain the price ranges associated with each product. The Default price book contains the base prices for products, which are displayed on the storefront as Price From. The Sale price book lists the sale price for the products in the Default price book. A seller can have only one Default price book and one Sale price book, but you can have multiple Customer Group price books. A Customer Group price book contains the discount prices that are presented only to customers who buy the product on a large scale.

Create a Default Price Book
The Default price book contains the base prices for products, which are displayed on the storefront as Price From. Usually, these prices are not the most advantageous price for marketing the product. You can have only one Default price book.
Create a Sale Price Book
The Sale price book lists the sale price for the products in the Default price book. You can have only one Sale price book.
Create a Customer Group Price Book
The Customer Group price book contains the discount prices that are presented only to customers who buy the product on a large scale.
Add Prices to a Price Book
You can add the different sale values of a product to a price book. After each price book is created, a price book entry is assigned to it. Price book entries provide a record of the sale values of a product. You can assign different prices to a product or variant if the quantity is different. For example, purchasing one unit of product yellow shirt is $10, while nine units of product yellow shirt is $7 each.
Edit a Price Book
From the Commerce Marketplace app, you can manage the price book information that sellers enter in the Seller Portal. You can also choose to share the Customer Groups you created with sellers by configuring the sharing rules during the implementation.
Configure Sharing Rules for Customer Groups
If you want to share the Customer Groups you created in the Commerce Marketplace app with sellers, configure the sharing rules during the implementation.

title: Understanding Price Books and Pricing Strategies
